Buttons

Options


<!-- Standard button -->
<button type="button" class="btn btn-default">Default</button>

<!-- Provides extra visual weight and identifies the primary action in a set of buttons -->
<button type="button" class="btn btn-primary">Primary</button>

<!-- Provides extreme awareness through the use of BoomTown orange -->
<button type="button" class="btn btn-attention">Attention</button>

<!-- Indicates a successful or positive action -->
<button type="button" class="btn btn-success">Success</button>

<!-- Contextual button for informational alert messages -->
<button type="button" class="btn btn-info">Info</button>

<!-- Indicates caution should be taken with this action -->
<button type="button" class="btn btn-warning">Warning</button>

<!-- Indicates a dangerous or potentially negative action -->
<button type="button" class="btn btn-danger">Danger</button>

<!-- Deemphasize a button by making it look like a link while maintaining button behavior -->
<button type="button" class="btn btn-link">Link</button>

Sizes


<button type="button" class="btn btn-default btn-lg">Large Button</button>
<button type="button" class="btn btn-default">Default Button</button>
<button type="button" class="btn btn-default btn-sm">Small Button</button>
<button type="button" class="btn btn-default btn-xs">Extra Small Button</button>

Create block level buttons-those that span the full width of a parent- by adding .btn-block.


<button type="button" class="btn btn-primary btn-lg btn-block">Block level button</button>
<button type="button" class="btn btn-default btn-lg btn-block">Block level button</button>

Active State

Button Element

No need to add :active as it's a pseudo-class, but if you need to force the same appearance, go ahead and add .active.


<button type="button" class="btn btn-primary active">Primary button</button>
<button type="button" class="btn btn-default active">Button</button>

Anchor Element

Add the .active class to <a> buttons.

Primary link Link 

<a href="#" class="btn btn-primary active" role="button">Primary link</a>
<a href="#" class="btn btn-default active" role="button">Link</a>

Disabled State

Button Element

Add the disabled attribute to <button> buttons.


<button type="button" class="btn btn-primary disabled">Primary button</button>
<button type="button" class="btn btn-default disabled">Button</button>

Anchor Element

Add the .disabled class to <a> buttons.

Primary link Link 

<a href="#" class="btn btn-primary disabled" role="button">Primary link</a>
<a href="#" class="btn btn-default disabled" role="button">Link</a>

Labels

Options

Default Primary Attention Success Info Warning Danger 

<span class="label label-default">Default</span>
<span class="label label-primary">Primary</span>
<span class="label label-attention">Attention</span>
<span class="label label-success">Success</span>
<span class="label label-info">Info</span>
<span class="label label-warning">Warning</span>
<span class="label label-danger">Danger</span>

Lead Categories

Default

Lead Category labels extend the .label class.

archive closed hot new nurture pending qualify trash watch 

<span class="cat cat-archive">archive</span>
<span class="cat cat-closed">closed</span>
<span class="cat cat-hot">hot</span>
<span class="cat cat-new">new</span>
<span class="cat cat-nurture">nurture</span>
<span class="cat cat-pending">pending</span>
<span class="cat cat-qualify">qualify</span>
<span class="cat cat-trash">trash</span>
<span class="cat cat-watch">watch</span>

Equal Width

For equal width Lead Category labels, use the .cat-eq class.

archive closed hot new nurture pending qualify trash watch 

<span class="cat cat-eq cat-archive">archive</span>
<span class="cat cat-eq cat-closed">closed</span>
<span class="cat cat-eq cat-hot">hot</span>
<span class="cat cat-eq cat-new">new</span>
<span class="cat cat-eq cat-nurture">nurture</span>
<span class="cat cat-eq cat-pending">pending</span>
<span class="cat cat-eq cat-qualify">qualify</span>
<span class="cat cat-eq cat-trash">trash</span>
<span class="cat cat-eq cat-watch">watch</span>

Equal Width - Abbreviated

For equal width Lead Category labels , use the .cat-eq-abbr class.

arch close hot new nurt pend qual trash watch 

<span class="cat cat-eq-abbr cat-archive">arch</span>
<span class="cat cat-eq-abbr cat-closed">close</span>
<span class="cat cat-eq-abbr cat-hot">hot</span>
<span class="cat cat-eq-abbr cat-new">new</span>
<span class="cat cat-eq-abbr cat-nurture">nurt</span>
<span class="cat cat-eq-abbr cat-pending">pend</span>
<span class="cat cat-eq-abbr cat-qualify">qual</span>
<span class="cat cat-eq-abbr cat-trash">trash</span>
<span class="cat cat-eq-abbr cat-watch">watch</span>

Typography

Headings

All HTML headings, <h1> through <h6>, are available. .h1 through .h6 classes are also available, for when you want to match the font styling of a heading but still want your text to be displayed inline.

h1. Boomstrap heading

h2. Boomstrap heading

h3. Boomstrap heading

h4. Boomstrap heading

h5. Boomstrap heading
h6. Boomstrap heading

<h1>h1. Boomstrap heading</h1>
<h2>h2. Boomstrap heading</h2>
<h3>h3. Boomstrap heading</h3>
<h4>h4. Boomstrap heading</h4>
<h5>h5. Boomstrap heading</h5>
<h6>h6. Boomstrap heading</h6>

Create lighter, secondary text in any heading with a generic <small> tag or the .small class.

h1. Bootstrap heading Secondary text

h2. Bootstrap heading Secondary text

h3. Bootstrap heading Secondary text

h4. Bootstrap heading Secondary text

h5. Bootstrap heading Secondary text
h6. Bootstrap heading Secondary text

<h1>h1. Bootstrap heading <small>Secondary text</small></h1>
<h2>h2. Bootstrap heading <small>Secondary text</small></h2>
<h3>h3. Bootstrap heading <small>Secondary text</small></h3>
<h4>h4. Bootstrap heading <small>Secondary text</small></h4>
<h5>h5. Bootstrap heading <small>Secondary text</small></h5>
<h6>h6. Bootstrap heading <small>Secondary text</small></h6>

Body Copy

Boomstrap's global default font-size is 14px, with a line-height of 1.428. This is applied to the <body> and all paragraphs. In addition, <p> (paragraphs) receive a bottom margin of half their computed line-height (10px by default).

Nullam quis risus eget urna mollis ornare vel eu leo. Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus mus. Nullam id dolor id nibh ultricies vehicula.

Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus mus. Donec ullamcorper nulla non metus auctor fringilla. Duis mollis, est non commodo luctus, nisi erat porttitor ligula, eget lacinia odio sem nec elit. Donec ullamcorper nulla non metus auctor fringilla.

Maecenas sed diam eget risus varius blandit sit amet non magna. Donec id elit non mi porta gravida at eget metus. Duis mollis, est non commodo luctus, nisi erat porttitor ligula, eget lacinia odio sem nec elit.


<p>...</p>

Lead Body Copy

Make a paragraph stand out by adding .lead.

Vivamus sagittis lacus vel augue laoreet rutrum faucibus dolor auctor. Duis mollis, est non commodo luctus.


<p class="lead">...</p>

Emphasis

Small Text

For de-emphasizing inline or blocks of text, use the <small> tag to set text at 85% the size of the parent. Heading elements receive their own font-size for nested <small> elements.

You may alternatively use an inline element with .small in place of any <small>.

This line of text is meant to be treated as fine print.


<small>This line of text is meant to be treated as fine print.</small>

Bold Text

For emphasizing a snippet of text with a heavier font-weight.

The following snippet of text is rendered as bold text.


<strong>rendered as bold text</strong>

Italics

For emphasizing a snippet of text with italics.

The following snippet of text is rendered as italicized text.


<em>rendered as italicized text</em>

Alternate Emphasis Elements

Feel free to use <b> and <i> in HTML5. <b> is meant to highlight words or phrases without conveying additional importance while <i> is mostly for voice, technical terms, etc.

Callouts

Use these to callout important information or display messages.

Callout Attention

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Suspendisse dapibus neque vel felis vehicula gravida. Aenean massa velit, bibendum nec convallis eu, imperdiet eu ante.

Callout Success

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Suspendisse dapibus neque vel felis vehicula gravida. Aenean massa velit, bibendum nec convallis eu, imperdiet eu ante.

Callout Info

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Suspendisse dapibus neque vel felis vehicula gravida. Aenean massa velit, bibendum nec convallis eu, imperdiet eu ante.

Callout Warning

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Suspendisse dapibus neque vel felis vehicula gravida. Aenean massa velit, bibendum nec convallis eu, imperdiet eu ante.

Callout Danger

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Suspendisse dapibus neque vel felis vehicula gravida. Aenean massa velit, bibendum nec convallis eu, imperdiet eu ante.


<div class="callout callout-attention">
  <h4>Callout Attention</h4>
  <p>Lorem ipsum dolor...</p>
</div>
<div class="callout callout-success">
  <h4>Callout Success</h4>
  <p>Lorem ipsum dolor...</p>
</div>
<div class="callout callout-info">
  <h4>Callout Info</h4>
  <p>Lorem ipsum dolor...</p>
</div>
<div class="callout callout-warning">
  <h4>Callout Warngin</h4>
  <p>Lorem ipsum dolor...</p>
</div>
<div class="callout callout-danger">
  <h4>Callout Danger</h4>
  <p>Lorem ipsum dolor...</p>
</div>
